Draw/Sheathe.description: You may draw or sheathe a weapon or weapon like item (like wands, shields) in easy reach. With a BAB of +1, you may draw a weapon as part of movement (not 5-foot step).

benefit.text: You may draw / sheathe a weapon

Manipulte Item.description: You may retrieve, store, or pick up an item, as well as move a heavy object or open a door.

benefit.text: You may retrieve, store, or pick up an item

Mount.description: You may mount or dismount your steed as a move action. You may also attempt a DC 20 Ride check to do it as a free action with no penaly.

benefit.text: You may mout or dismount your steed

Stand Up.description: You may stand up as a move action that provokes and attack of opportunity. You may also crawl 5 ft as a move action that provokes an AoO and counts as prone.

benefit.text: You may stand up from prone, provoking AoO

Aid Another.description: Make an attack roll vs AC 10, if you hit, you assist an ally with an attack, their defense, or a particular skill.

benefit.text: +2 to Attack Rolls, AC, or a specific skill check

Bull Rush.description: Push an opponent 5 ft back, and an additional 5 ft for every 5 your CMB check exceeds your opponents CMD. This provokes AoO, and you can only push an opponent up to one size category larger than you.

benefit.text: You may push an enemy back 5 or more feet

Dirty Trick.description: Apply Blinded, Dazzled, Deafened, Entangled, Shaken, or Sickened to an enemy for 1 round, and an additional round for every 5 your CMB check exceeds your opponents CMD. This provokes AoO

benefit.text: Apply a number of hindering conditions

Disarm.description: Force an enemy to drop an item in their hands (or 2 if you exceed by 10). If you fail by 10 you drop the item you were using to disarm. This provokes AoO and you take a -4 to disarm while unarmed (but automatically pick up the dropped item.

benefit.text: Force an enemy to drop an item

Drag.description: Pull an opponent in a straight line behind you 5 ft, and an additional 5 ft for every 5 you exceed your foes CMD. This provokes AoO, and you can only drag a foe no more than one size category larger than you.

benefit.text: Pull an opponent in a straight line behind you

Feint.description: Make a Bluff check, on a success your opponent losses their Dex bonus to AC against your melee attack next turn.

benefit.text: Opponent loses their Dex bonus to AC

Grapple.description: Grapple with an opponent, allowing you to also move, damage, pin, or tie up, your oppenent.

Overrun.description: You run through someone's square with a CMB check, if you suceed by 5 or more, they are knocked prone. This provokes AoO.

benefit.text: Bowl someone over, passing through their square

Total Defense.description: You get a +4 bonus to your AC but cannot make Attacks of Opportunity until your next turn.

Charge.description: You may move up to double your speed (min 10 ft), directly to your enemy and make one attack with an additional +2 to hit and a -2 to AC until your next turn.

benefit.text: Move up to double your speed and attack at a +2

Coup de Grace.description: If the defender is helpless, you may automatically hit and score a critical. If the defender survives the damage, they must make a Fort save DC 10 + damage dealt, or die.

benefit.text: Hit and Crit a helpless defender

Run.description: You may run in a straight line up to 4x your speed, or 3x in heavy armor. You also lose your Dex bonus to AC unless you have the Run feat.

benefit.text: Move up to 4x your speed in a straight line

Withdraw.description: You may move up to double your speed, and your starting square is not considered threatened for AoOs.

benefit.text: You may leave your square without AoO

conditions.name: Bleeding
conditions.description: You are bleeding and take the listed amount of damage at the beginning of every turn, it can be staunched with a DC 15 Heal check or any magical healing.

conditions.name: Blinded
conditions.description: You are blind and cannot see, automatically failing checks that rely on vision, and granting enemies total concealment from you (50% miss chance). You must make a DC 10 Acrobatics check to move faster than half speed or fall prone.

conditions.name: Confused
conditions.description: You are mentally befuddled and cannot act normally. Roll on the confusion table on the wiki.

conditions.name: Cowering
conditions.description: You are frozen in fear and can take no actions.

conditions.name: Dazed
conditions.description: You are unable to act normally and can take no actions, but have no penalty to AC.

conditions.name: Dazzled
conditions.description: You are unable to see well because of over-stimulation of the eyes. You take a â€“1 penalty on attack rolls and sight-based Perception checks.

conditions.name: Deafened
conditions.description: You cannot hear, and automatically fail sound based Perception checks, and have a 20% spell failure chance for spells with verbal components.

bonuses.name: Disabled
bonuses.description: You may take a single move OR standard action each round (nor can you take full-round actions, but you can still take swift, immediate, and free actions). You move at half speed, and performing any standard action (or any other action the GM deems strenuous, including some free actions such as casting a Quicken Spell spell) deals 1 point of damage after the completion of the act, and you are now dying.

bonuses.name: Dying
bonuses.description: You are unconscious, near death, and can take no actions. On all subsequent turns, make a DC 10 Stabilization check or lose 1 HP. If you have negative HP equal to your Constitution score, you die.

bonuses.name: Entangled
bonuses.description: You are ensnared, and move at half speed (unless the bonds are anchored somehow). Attempting to cast a spell requiers a concentration check (DC 15 + pell level).

bonuses.name: Exhausted
bonuses.description: You move at half speed and cannot run or charge. After 1 hour of complete rest, you become fatigued instead of exhausted.

bonuses.name: Fascinated
bonuses.description: You are entranced by a supernatural or spell effect and can take no actions other than to pay attention the fascinating effect. Potential threats grant additional save chances, and obvious threats break fascination. An ally may use a standard action to break you free of the effect.

bonuses.name: Fatigued
bonuses.description: You can neither run nor charge, and doing anything that would cause fatigue, makes you exhausted instead. 8 hours of complete rest removes fatigue.

bonuses.name: Frightened
bonuses.description: You must flee from the source of the fear as best you can, and if you are unable to flee you may fight. Frightened is more extreme than shaken, with panicked being even more than frightened.

bonuses.name: Grappled
bonuses.description: You are restrained by a creature, trap, or effect and cannot move, or take actions that require two hands to perform. Attempting a spell or spell-like ability requires a concentration check (DC 10 + grappler's CMB + spell level).

bonuses.name: Helpless
bonuses.description: You are completely at an opponent's mercy and melee attacks get a +4 bonus against you.

bonuses.name: Incorporeal
bonuses.description: You have no physical body, are immune to all nonmagical attacks, take half damage from magic weapons, spells, spell-like effects, and supernatural effects, and take full damage from other incorporeal creatures and effects, as well as force effects.

bonuses.name: Invisible
bonuses.description: You are visually undetectable, and ignore opponents' Dex bonus to AC.

bonuses.name: Nauseated
bonuses.description: You are experiencign stomach distress, may only take a single move action, and are unable to attack, cast spells, concentrate on spells, or do anything requiring attention.

bonuses.name: Panicked
bonuses.description: You must drop anything you are holding and flee at top speed from the source of your fear, and any additionall dangers you encounter, along a random path (1d8). If cornered, you must cower but may use total defense.

bonuses.name: Prone
bonuses.description: The character is lying on the ground. A prone attacker has a â€“4 penalty on melee attack rolls and cannot use a ranged weapon (except for a crossbow). A prone defender gains a +4 bonus to Armor Class against ranged attacks, but takes a â€“4 penalty to AC against melee attacks.
